title: Asset Management license
content:
You can assign a trial license or a license key to the tenant. Follow the below steps to create or upload an Asset Management license and assign it to a tenant.

You can't assign both a Service Management license (Express or Premium) and an Asset Management license to the same tenant. If you try to do this, an error occurs.

Create a trial license

You can create a trial license manually.

  1. From the main menu, click Licenses.
  2. Click New.
  3. Complete the form with the required information. See License details below.
  4. Click Save.

Upload a license key

You can upload a production, non-production, or evaluation license key to the suite for a newly installed or renewed license.

  1. From the main menu, select Licenses.
  2. Click Upload licenses on the toolbar.
  3. Select the license mode.
  4. Click Choose File to select your license file.
  5. Click Import. You can get a preview of license information and licensable features.
  6. Click OK.

 All suite license files can be uploaded here, supported formats include ov4key, xml, and dat. Currently, only Service Management, Cloud Management, and Asset Management licenses can be managed in Suite Administration, hence only these licenses are shown in the grid; other product component licenses are installed to APLS, and you can retrieve and install licensable features in APLS. For more information, see Service Management licenses and Cloud Management license.

Edit a license

  1. From the main menu, select Licenses.
  2. Click the license in the ID column to display the selected license.
  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit. See License details below.
  4. Save the changes.
  • The license information of a production, non-production, or evaluation license is read from the license key, only the Name and Description fields are editable. 
  • After a trial license is added to a license pool, the Mode and Capacity fields aren't editable.
  • An Asset Management unit license is marked with a "Unit" tag in the license list when you click Licenses from the main menu. You can allocate Asset Management license units to concurrent users and named users from the Allocation tab of the selected unit license. 

License details

General tab

Field Description
ID License ID.
Mode

Displays the license mode. Values include:

  • Trial
  • Production
  • Evaluation
  • Non-Production

For a trial license, the system automatically assigns the Trial mode; for non-trial licenses, the system reads the mode from the license key.  
Name

Name of the license.

If the license is a unit license, a "Unit" tag is displayed.
Access type

This field is available only for an Asset Management trial license (it's impossible to create an Asset Management trial license of the Unit access type):

  • Concurrent user: This license is based on the number of simultaneous users accessing the system.
  • Named user: Only named users can access the system. The tenant admin needs to assign the license to users in the system.
This field isn't available for Asset Management unit licenses. With a unit license, you have the flexibility of allocating the license capacity to different combinations of concurrent users and named users. 
Edition

License edition: Asset Management
Start date Start date of the license.
End date

End date of the license.

The maximum duration for a trial license is 90 days.
Capacity Capacity of the license.
Product number

Identifier of the product activated by the license:

  • SMAX: for a Service Management (Express or Premium) license
  • HCMX: for a Cloud Management license
  • AMX: for an Asset Management license
Feature Determines the licensable feature.
Feature version Version retrieved from the license file. Only applicable to Production, Non-production, and Evaluation licenses.
License pool

Displays the license pool ID if this license is added to a license pool. 

This field isn't available for Asset Management unit licenses.
Description Description of the license.

Allocation tab

The Allocation tab is only available for a unit license.

Except for trial licenses, Asset Management licenses (production, evaluation, and non-production) are all unit licenses. Use this tab to convert the available units in the unit license to the user-based licenses for concurrent users or named users, assign the allocated licenses to a license pool, view the assignment history, or revoke the assignments.

To allocate the license units, follow these steps:

  1. Specify the number of concurrent users and named users that you want to have. The calculation is as follows:
    • 2 units = 1 concurrent user
    • 1 unit = 1 named user
  2. Click ALLOCATE. A confirmation message is displayed.
  3. Click ALLOCATE to confirm your allocation. The license units are now converted for concurrent users and named users.
    To successfully allocate the license units, make sure that your allocation meets the following conditions:
    • The number of the total required units for allocation is no more than the total capacity.
    • The number of user-based licenses specified in your allocation must be more than the number of licenses that are already in use in the assignments.
      If you want to allocate fewer licenses than the ones already in use, you need to revoke some assignments first. To revoke an assignment based on the unit license, select an assignment in the Assignment history section, and then click Revoke. If the assignment is revoked successfully, the Is revoked field is changed to True.

To add the allocated licenses to a license pool, follow these steps:

  1. Select the allocated licenses for concurrent users, named users, or both.
  2. Click Add to license pool.
  3. Select a license pool and click Add.
    After you add the licenses to a license pool, you can assign the converted user-based licenses from this pool to a tenant from the License tab on the tenant detail page.

License status

You can change the license status between Active and Inactive manually when the license isn't added to a license pool.

Status Description
Active Only Active licenses can be added to a license pool.
Inactive Inactive licenses can't be added to a license pool.

To inactivate the unit license, you must inactivate the allocated child licenses first.
Retired

The license status becomes Retired automatically when the license end date arrives.

  • You can't add retired licenses to a license pool.
  • You can't edit or delete retired licenses.

Add to license pool

Licenses are aggregated in license pools, you can assign multiple licenses in a license pool to one tenant.

You can't directly add the parent unit license (marked with a "Unit" tag in the Name column) to a license pool. First, do allocation from the Allocation tab of the unit license, and then add the allocated child licenses to a license pool.

  1. From the main menu, select Licenses.
  2. Select one or multiple licenses and click Add to license pool.
  3. Select a license pool and click Add. Licenses with the same properties (mode, start date, end date, edition, and access type) are combined into one entry in the license pool and the capacities are summed. 

Synchronize license information from AutoPass

If licenses are uploaded directly in AutoPass, you can synchronize license information from AutoPass to Suite Administration.

  1. From the main menu, click Licenses.
  2. Click License reconciliation.
  3. Click CONFIRM.

Delete a license

To delete a license, follow these steps:

  1. In Suite Administration, revoke the license from tenants if you have already assigned this license to tenants. To do this, go to the Licenses tab of the tenant, and then click Revoke to revoke the license. Note that the experience mode of tenants might be affected when you revoke the license, you need to contact the tenant administrators to double-check the experience mode of the tenants. We recommend that you assign new licenses to tenants before revoking any licenses if you intend to modify the license capacity.
  2. (For unit license only) In Suite Administration, go to the Allocation tab in the detail page of the unit license, set the capacity to 0 for both concurrent users and named users, and then click Allocate.
  3. Log in to AutoPass as the OMT admin user: https://<External_Access_Host>/autopass. From LICENSE > VIEW, select the license, and then click the ARCHIVE button to uninstall the license.
  4. In Suite Administration, click Licenses, and then click License reconciliation.

Assign and revoke a license for a tenant

For details, see Licenses. 

Related topics

  • Licenses
  • License pools
  • Service Management licenses
  • Cloud Management license
